title: Pep Guardiola's Man City have a brilliant record when Willy Caballero plays
text:
Pep Guardiola's Man City have a brilliant record when Willy Caballero plays The Manchester City goalkeeper is certainly enjoying himself this season Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now City v West Ham player ratings Share this video Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Willy Caballero's terrific season continued on Wednesday night as he earned the gloves for the Premier League game at West Ham. 
The Argentine has been the keeper in cup competitions under Pep Guardiola , as he has been for most of his time at Manchester City . 
But beating Claudio Bravo to the No.1 spot at the London Stadium was significant - and Caballero followed it up with another clean sheet. 
City's record with the veteran stopper in goal this season is exceptional. 
In 11 games this season (four Premier League, three Champions League and two each in the domestic cups), City's record reads: W9 D1 L1. 
Caballero has kept four clean sheets - including consecutively in his last three games - and not conceded more than one goal in the other matches, an average of 0.6 goals per game. Read More Man City stars Gabriel Jesus and Yaya Toure named in Champions League squad 
And City rack up the goals too when he plays, scoring 32 at an average of nearly three a game and only failing to net once. 
The statistics, of course, do not tell the full story but City's League Cup hero must be enjoying an Indian summer at the club that few would have predicted when Guardiola took over last summer. 
At the very least, it should give the coach food for thought as he weighs up which players to keep on and give new contracts to at the end of the season. Read More
